For those wanting to know about the actual quality, like the file heading says, it's been cropped. Unfortunately it seems a bad aspect ratio has resulted from the cropping process; the video frame is elongated, meaning the picture has been stretched vertically. Minor adjustments can be made in VLC to reduce the effect but you can not achieve a 'true' image (to the best of my attempts), therefore subjects and objects will always be stretched vertically to some degree. Many people seem to not be bothered by incorrect ratios, such as when a 4:3 ratio TV show or movie is stretched horizontally to a 16:9 ratio to fit modern TVs. I personally can not tolerate it as I'm aware I'm not looking at a 'true' image. While the picture quality of this torrent is fine, it's essentially ruined from the vertical stretching, so I will wait for a proper version. A8/V1. Thx all the same to extremezone.
